name: catachresis
text: They talked about this.

name: carpetbag
text: I am not quite certain what happened in the last three panels, yet I feel this uncertainty adds to the humor.

name: mrsmuckles
text: I believe Ray clambers down from the couch, glowers at Connie for touching on a sensitive subject, and stalks off.

name: ttagxamm
text: See, I've always thought he gets so worked up he falls off the couch.

name: rowboat
text: Ray's had enough. He don't need this.

name: hipjiverobot
text: Naw, he's a cat so he doesn't reach a normal height. This is the source of the humor.

name: c_dizzle
text: Ha Ha!...Sulking.

name: jstegall
text: I love how Cornelius Bear can make Ray shut up and leave with just one line.

name: howard
text:
dude

that is because cornelius bear is The Shit.

name: ninjaein
text: I swear to God, Cornelius Bear has participated in many Badass Games to perfect his style over the years.

name: paco
text: So who is more of a man- Ray, for winning the GOF, or Cornelius Bear, for winning the Badass Games?

name: zedpower
text:
As much as I like the idea of eggless Sardinian dough, you can't cook a massive furious nazi from San Bernardino.

I love it when I rhyme accidentally! It's like a little gift from my brain to me.

...dang! Today is wonderful!

name: wozzeck
text:
I see as like arguing who is more man, a MMA champion or a hardened Special Forces veteran.

Throw them in a ring together, with rules and a referee, odds are extremely likely the MMA man will come out on top, for he is in the controlled element, ultimately just a game, in which he has specialized.

Reverse the situation, and drop the MMA guy naked into the wilderness, and he will likely be dead within a week. Drop him into a fire fight, and he will probably stand paralyzed with fear until he is cut down. Put him into hand-to-hand combat in an Afghani hovel, and his attempts to beat the other man into submission will be cut short when his enemy gouges out his eyes or caves in his skull with an improvised weapon.

Ray proved himself the best man at the GOF.

Cornelius proved himself the best man at life .

name: greenkoolayd
text: fuck-diddly-uck yes

name: smallberries
text: Put the same hardened Special Forces veteran into any social or cultural setting that requires sensitivity or nuance and he'll be dead in a week.

name: mira
text: I sympathize with Ray. Africa? South America? The Caribbean? it's hard to tell when it's always a bunch of bitchy twenty to thirty-somethings sittin' on the dirt, Jeff Probst all teasing them with hamburgers and videos from their families.

name: stereo
text: In a less civilized era, we would have called this kidnapping.

name: tekende
text: I still refuse to believe that the people in the show are actually undergoing all of that. They MIGHT be in the location claimed, I'll concede that is a possibility. But they are most certainly not starving and dirty. There's no doubt in my mind that they are provided plenty of food, water, a shower, a bed, etc.

name: greenkoolayd
text: that doesnt ecplain the extreme weight loss they go through.  at the end the people look gaunt as fuck.

name: greenkoolayd
text: **e X plain

name: fineoakstructure
text: yeah c'mon tekende splain that shit

name: tekende
text: Weight loss programs? Special effects? Makeup? Body doubles?

name: madnes
text:
Where does Ray go? Does he just skootch* on outta there?

*spelling in contention.

name: jamers
text: I've always preferred scootch, but that's just me. He's gonna get his drink on, naturally.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: I never thought about my preferred spelling of scootch before. Thank you, Achewood forums!

name: charchar
text: I think it's 'scooch:' honestly, I feel Ray straight up skedaddled.

name: psykeres
text: I like to imagine that Ray has been getting his slant on and just plain old eased himself to the floor, supine.

name: closefriend
text: Just for perspective, when this strip was written, that would have been Jenna Morasca who won Survivor, famous for being extremely mean to a deaf girl and stripping for peanut butter. To be fair, she was only a sorry-assed crybaby because she was waiting for Ray to cold fly her ass out and buy her some more peanut butter.

name: zapatos
text: I should probably get that season, because that is hell of awesome.

name: djwhiterabbit
text:
i like the point of the diminutive size of the characters as ray dismounts from the couch and has to look up at cornelius. such small characters having such sass is hella comedy.

however, this aspect of the achewood reality seems sometimes flexible . (unless there are cat-sized grills and telephones and martini glasses in achewood, which is entirely probable. maybe this particular couch is human-sized because ray is visiting cornelius at the onstad residence. or maybe i'm thinking about this far too hard.)

name: red_dawn
text: Achewood deserves that level of contemplation.

name: digdugz
text:
I think you're right.

Plus the presence of the achewood underground means its entirely plausible that there could be mini stufffor them to use.

name: joestork
text:
Ha ha, Stufffor.

That took me a long time to figure out, mainly because it is such an excellent word on its own.

name: woodenteeth
text: Poor Ray, the kicker is that Survivor is all shot in a studio. Like the moon landing. Mr. Bear tries not to bring that up.

name: philosophe
text: Television seems to be the only thing Cornelius does not have discriminating taste in. I mean, Survivor, Gilmore Girls? Come on.

name: saucy_jack
text: I think he accepts the specific type of enjoyment provided by such shows and is not perturbed by the social stigma of liking something that Cool people consider lame.

name: honesttom
text: It's the accusing glower in the penultimate panel that does it for me.

name: derekjames
text: I always assumed that Ray was drunk and slid off the couch.

name: rowboat
text: Onstad really has a knack for saving a scuffling strip at the last moment.

name: hendetta
text: When they are side by side Connie almost looks like a rough, less detailed Ray.

name: doomsdaybadger
text: I love yelling this at my friends when I lose arguments.

name: zeal
text: It took Ray three strips to deal with the Little Nephew attack. But when Ray starts to mouch, it takes Cornelius only one panel. Dude is raaaaaawwwww .

name: sp1derbaby
text: The indignation? Substantial.

name: snowman
text:
Amazing.

That glare actually raised Corny's eyebrows.

Also, I'd like to point out (as someone already has) that these are cats sitting on a human-proportioned couch, so in that second-to-last panel, Ray is standing . I agree that it might be funnier if he scooched out on his butt, but I think he just walks away.

name: tekende
text:
Thank you for putting that image in my head. Thank you.

I am not being sarcastic.

name: readingcomics
text:
after reading all the comments and then eyeing in on panel 5, it's really that Ray is scooting off the couch because, as shown, he uses his arms to brace his fragile self from the upscaled fall. Even though it's totally unnecesary because Ray is a cat.

bling bling

name: sweetlips
text: I loooooooooooooooooooooooove this one. Just so you know.

name: berami
text:
Ray demands that his conversations be REMEMBERED, dammit!
We TALKED about this!

name: wallabeechamp
text: Who knew Ray was a woman? Because every time I get a "we talked about this," it means my girl made a decision based on some vague talk we had.

name: courtland
text: Ray certainly seems to be a master of the look. He takes after his father Ramses after all, what with the art of leaving.

name: carlyle
text: It wasn't even a question. Cornelius can beat down Ray with one shot and he knows it.

name: puguglypress
text: I love the period (as opposed to question mark) at the end of "so why didn't you, Ray."
